actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 51.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 51 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to cut funding for the Southwest Border Regional Commission in half and transfer the difference to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 50, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Perry demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 50.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 50 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to cut funding for the Great Lakes Authority in half and transfer the difference to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 49, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Perry demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 49.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 49 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to reduce funding for the Northern Border Regional Commission to FY19 levels and transfer the difference to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 48, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Perry demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 48.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 48 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to reduce funding for the Southeast Crescent Regional Commission to FY19 levels and transfer the difference to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 47, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Perry demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 47.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 47 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to reduce funding for the Denali Regional Commission to FY19 levels and transfer the difference to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 46, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Perry demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 46.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 46 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to reduce funding for the Delta Regional Commission to FY19 levels and transfer the difference to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 45, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Fleischmann demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 45.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 45 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to reduce funding for the Appalachian Regional Commission to FY19 levels and transfer the difference to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 44, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kaptur demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 44.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 44 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to eliminate funding for the Title 17 Loan Program and moves that funding to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 43, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kaptur demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 43.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 43 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to eliminate funding for the Advanced Technology Vehicles Manufacturing Loan Program and moves this funding to the spending reduction account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 42, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Fitzpatrick demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 42.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 42 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit the use of funds for the Delaware River Basin Commission to implement or enforce its ban on hydraulic fracturing.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 41.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 41 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds to be used to finalize the rule entitled "Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Consumer Water Heaters."
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 40.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 40 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds to be used to finalize the rule entitled Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Automatic Commercial Ice Makers."
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 38.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 38 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds for Department of Energy Office of Science's Office of Scientific Workforce Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 37.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 37 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funding for the Interagency Working Group on the Social Cost of Greenhouse Gases.

At the conclusion of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 36, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kaptur demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 36.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 36 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funding for the American Climate Corps.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 35.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 35 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funding for the consideration of the social cost of greenhouse gases.
On agreeing to the McCormick amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the McCormick amendment No. 25.

An amendment, offered by Mr. McCormick,  numbered 25 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds provided by this Act from closing campgrounds operated by the Army Corps of Engineers that are located at Lake Sidney Lanier, Georgia.
On agreeing to the Luna amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Luna amendment No. 23.

An amendment, offered by Mrs. Luna,  numbered 23 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds from being made available to implement or enforce Corps of Engineers memorandum CERE-AP, issued by the South Atlantic division on July 9, 1996, relating to "Approval of Perpetual Beach Storm Damage Reduction Easement as a Standard Estate."
On agreeing to the Jackson (TX) amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Jackson (TX) amendment No. 20.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Jackson (TX),  numbered 20 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds from being used by the NNSA to halt the construction of the HE Synthesis, Formulation, and Production facility at Pantex.
On agreeing to the Houlahan amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Houlahan amendment No. 19.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Houlahan,  numbered 19 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to increase and decrease funding for the Grid Deployment account by $150 million to emphasize the need to address domestic shortages of large power transformers and distribution transformers through authorities within the Defense Production Act.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 18.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 18 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit the Department of Energy from implementing the Industrial Decarbonization Roadmap.
On agreeing to the Griffith amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Griffith amendment No. 17.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Griffith,  numbered 17 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to increase funding for the Department of Energy's Fossil Energy and Carbon Management program by $8,750,000 while reducing funding for Departmental Administration by $8,750,000.
On agreeing to the Beyer amendment; Failed by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Beyer amendment No. 11.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Beyer,  numbered 11 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds made available by this Act to be used for the Savannah River Plutonium Modernization Program.
On agreeing to the Beyer amendment; Failed by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Beyer amendment No. 10.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Beyer,  numbered 10 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds made available for this Act to be used for the W87-1 modification program.
On agreeing to the Flood amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Flood amendment No. 9.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Flood,  numbered 9 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funding for lab-grown meat at the Department of Energy.
On agreeing to the Brecheen amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Brecheen amendment No. 4.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Brecheen,  numbered 4 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds to reinstate the general license for export of nuclear material to China.
On agreeing to the Fleischmann amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the Fleischmann amendment en bloc.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Fleischmann,  comprised of the following amendments printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 as en bloc: Nos. 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 12, 13, 14, 15, 21, 24, 26, 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 39, 52, 57, 58, 59, and 65.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 8997.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Brad R. Wenstrup to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 1370 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8997 and H.R. 8998. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8997 and H.R. 8998 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1370. H.R. 8997 — "Making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 404
actions-list.actionItem: 3 (Roll no. 362).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 227 — "To amend title 28, United States Code, to provide an additional place for holding court for the Pecos Division of the Western District of Texas, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 408
actions-list.actionItem: 2 (Roll no. 361).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 3706 — "To amend section 3663A of title 18, United States Code, to clarify that restitution includes necessary and reasonable expenses incurred by a person who has assumed the victim's rights."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 211
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 188

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 1370 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8997) making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8998) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 1370, agreeing to H. Res. 1370, if ordered, and motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 23.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1370, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1370.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1370 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8997) making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8998) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mrs. Ramirez to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable John W. Rose to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
